   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of the server implemented by diameter_stats.erl.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_stats_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          parallel/1]).
   35: 
   36: -define(stat, diameter_stats).
   37: 
   38: %% ===========================================================================
   39: 
   40: suite() ->
   41:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
   42: 
   43: all() ->
   44:     [parallel].
   45: 
   46: parallel(_Config) ->
   47:     run().
   48: 
   49: %% ===========================================================================
   50: 
   51: %% run/0
   52: 
   53: run() ->
   54:     run([reg, incr, read, sum, flush]).
   55: 
   56: %% run/1
   57: 
   58: run(List)
   59:   when is_list(List) ->
   60:     ok = diameter:start(),
   61:     try
   62:         diameter_util:run([{[fun run/1, T], 15000} || T <- List])
   63:     after
   64:         ok = diameter:stop()
   65:     end;
   66: 
   67: run(reg) ->
   68:     Ref = '$1',
   69:     true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
   70:     false = ?stat:reg(Ref);  %% duplicate
   71: 
   72: run(incr) ->
   73:     Ref = '_',
   74:     Ctr = x,
   75:     false = ?stat:incr(Ctr),      %% not registered,
   76:     1 = ?stat:incr(Ctr, Ref, 1),  %% only pids need register
   77:     true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
   78:     spawn(fun() ->
   79:                   true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
   80:                   2 = ?stat:incr(Ctr, self(), 2)
   81:           end),
   82:     ok = fold(Ctr, Ref, 3),  %% folded
   83:     ?stat:flush([self(), Ref]);
   84: 
   85: run(read) ->
   86:     Ref = make_ref(),
   87:     C1 = {a,b},
   88:     C2 = {b,a},
   89:     true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
   90:     1 = ?stat:incr(C1),
   91:     1 = ?stat:incr(C2),
   92:     2 = ?stat:incr(C1),
   93:     7 = ?stat:incr(C1, Ref, 7),
   94:     Self = self(),
   95:     [{Ref,  [{C1,7}]}, {Self, [{C1,2}, {C2,1}]}]
   96:         = ?stat:read([self(), Ref, make_ref()]),
   97:     [] = ?stat:read([]),
   98:     [] = ?stat:read([make_ref()]),
   99:     ?stat:flush([self(), Ref, make_ref()]);
  100: 
  101: run(sum) ->
  102:     Ref = make_ref(),
  103:     C1 = {a,b},
  104:     C2 = {b,a},
  105:     true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
  106:     1 = ?stat:incr(C1),
  107:     1 = ?stat:incr(C2),
  108:     2 = ?stat:incr(C2),
  109:     7 = ?stat:incr(C1, Ref, 7),
  110:     [{Ref,  [{C1,8}, {C2,2}]}]
  111:         = ?stat:sum([Ref, make_ref()]),
  112:     Self = self(),
  113:     [{Self,  [{C1,1}, {C2,2}]}]
  114:         = ?stat:sum([self()]),
  115:     [{Ref, [{C1,7}]}, {Self, [{C1,1}, {C2,2}]}]
  116:         = ?stat:flush([self(), Ref]);
  117: 
  118: run(flush) ->
  119:     Ref = make_ref(),
  120:     Ctr = '_',
  121:     true = ?stat:reg(Ref),
  122:     1 = ?stat:incr(Ctr),
  123:     3 = ?stat:incr(Ctr, self(), 2),
  124:     2 = ?stat:incr(Ctr, Ref, 2),
  125:     Self = self(),
  126:     [{Self, [{Ctr, 3}]}] = ?stat:flush([self()]),
  127:     1 = ?stat:incr(Ctr),
  128:     [{Ref,  [{Ctr, 2}]}] = ?stat:flush([Ref]),
  129:     [{Self, [{Ctr, 1}]}] = ?stat:flush([self()]),
  130:     [] = ?stat:flush([self(), Ref]).
  131: 
  132: %% ===========================================================================
  133: 
  134: %% Keep incremented until a fold results in the specified value.
  135: fold(Ctr, Ref, N) ->
  136:     case ?stat:incr(Ctr, Ref, 0) of
  137:         N ->
  138:             ok;
  139:         M when M < N ->
  140:             erlang:yield(),
  141:             fold(Ctr, Ref, N)
  142:     end.
